name: Welcome Stamp
address: Anywhere in the world
about:
Welcome to Stampbook!
This is your first special stamp that you can claim from anywhere.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Tap "Collect Stamp"
Go out there and explore the world!

name: Baker Beach
address:
1504 Pershing Dr
San Francisco, CA, USA 94129
about: A public beach with stunning Golden Gate Bridge views.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Bring a picnic blanket and relax with the Golden Gate
Hike Batteries to Bluffs Trail along the cliffs

name: Dolores Park
address:
Dolores St & 19th St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94114
about: Local favorite park with wide open grassy areas perfect for people watching.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Grab Crème Brûlée ice cream from Bi-Rite
Visit the southwest corner at sunset

name: Pier 39
address:
Beach St & The Embarcadero
San Francisco, CA, USA 94133
about: Popular waterfront marketplace famous for resident sea lions, shops, and stunning bay views.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Go to the end and smell the sea lions
Walk to Fisherman’s Wharf and Ghirardelli Chocolate

name: Ferry Building
address:
1 Ferry Building
San Francisco, CA, USA 94111
about: Historic terminal and marketplace with artisan food vendors and iconic clock tower.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Find porchetta sandwich during the Saturday farmers' market (8am-2pm)
Taste Vietnamese Coffee ice cream from Humphry Slocombe

name: Oracle Park
address:
24 Willie Mays Plaza
San Francisco, CA, USA 94107
about: Home of the San Francisco Giants and one of baseball's most beautiful ballparks.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Order garlic fries and crab sandwich - two ballpark food legends
Walk along the San Francisco Bay Trail to see under the Bay Bridge

name: Twin Peaks
address:
501 Twin Peaks Blvd
San Francisco, CA, USA 94114
about: One of the highest points in the city with 360-degree panoramic views.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Arrive 30 minutes before sunset
Bring layers - it gets windy and cold

name: Japantown
address:
1610 Geary Blvd
San Francisco, CA, USA 94115
about: One of the oldest Japanese communities in the US with authentic restaurants and shops.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Browse Japanese snacks, drinks, and bento at Nijiya Market
Eat amazing udon, yakitori, takoyaki, matcha ice cream, and mochi donuts

name: Powell-Hyde Cable Car
address:
Cable Car Turnaround Powell St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94102
about: One of San Francisco's most scenic cable car routes with stunning bay views.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Board at Powell & Market early morning to avoid 2-hour waits
Stand on the outer running board going down Hyde Street for thrilling bay views

name: Palace of Fine Arts
address:
3301 Lyon St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94123
about: Stunning Greco-Roman monument with a rotunda and lagoon built for the 1915 Exposition.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Visit at golden hour for stunning light on the rotunda reflected in the lagoon
Walk around the entire lagoon to find different angles of the columns

name: Painted Ladies
address:
710-720 Steiner St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94117
about: Iconic row of Victorian houses at Alamo Square, famous from Full House.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Bring a picnic blanket and snacks to enjoy the view from the park
Take photos from the Alamo Square lawn in late afternoon when the houses glow golden

name: Golden Gate Viewpoint
address:
Old Conzelman Rd
Mill Valley, CA, USA 94941
about: Breathtaking elevated views of the Golden Gate Bridge from the Marin Headlands.
thingsToDoFromEditors: You need a car to drive up here
You can see the Golden Gate with San Francisco from the other side

name: Equator Coffee
address:
Golden Gate Bridge Plaza
San Francisco, CA, USA 94129
about: This is in the Round House Café, which has an amazing view of the Golden Gate Bridge.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Order the single-origin pour-over to taste their roasting expertise
Walk to Baker Beach to collect another stamp

name: The Coffee Movement
address:
2814 19th St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94110
about: Mission District location serving specialty coffee and fresh donuts in a cozy space.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Order their donuts with specialty coffee for the perfect pairing
Note: This location has very short hours - if you want to try their coffee, check out another branch!

name: Andytown Coffee Roasters
address:
800 Great Hwy
San Francisco, CA, USA 94121
about: Coffee roasters near Ocean Beach famous for the Snowy Plover affogato.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Order the Snowy Plover (brown sugar ice cream + espresso) - their signature drink
Take your drink to Ocean Beach and relax by the water

name: Neighbor's Corner
address:
499 Douglass St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94114
about: A local gem serving exceptional coffee with Japanese-inspired pastries and dishes.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Order their house drip coffee with a fresh pastry
Grab a seat by the window and watch the neighborhood go by

name: The Mill
address:
736 Divisadero St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94117
about: Famous for Four Barrel coffee and house-made artisan toast.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Order the cinnamon sugar toast - their iconic signature item
Walk to Alamo Square and the Painted Ladies 10 minutes away

name: Saint Frank Coffee
address:
2340 Polk St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94109
about: Bright, minimalist café serving meticulously sourced coffee.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Ask baristas about their rotating single-origin espresso - they love sharing details
Try the cortado to experience their roasting at its purest

name: Sightglass Coffee
address:
270 7th St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94103
about: Spacious SoMa warehouse café where they roast their own beans on-site.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Watch them roast coffee through the glass-walled roasting room
Try the espresso tonic on warm days - refreshing and caffeinated

name: Four Barrel Coffee
address:
375 Valencia St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94103
about: Beloved Mission District roaster known for quality and direct trade.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Order classic drip coffee to taste their legendary roasting
Explore Clarion Alley's murals one block away at Valencia & 17th

name: Pinhole Coffee
address:
231 Cortland Ave
San Francisco, CA, USA 94110
about: Cozy Bernal Heights café serving exceptional specialty coffee.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Order their perfectly crafted flat white at the window bar
Walk up to Bernal Heights Park for panoramic city views

name: Ballast Coffee
address:
329 W Portal Ave
San Francisco, CA, USA 94127
about: West Portal neighborhood café serving thoughtfully sourced coffee in a minimalist space.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Order a pour-over and enjoy the relaxed neighborhood vibe
Explore the shops and restaurants along W Portal Avenue

name: Japanese Tea Garden
address: 75 Hagiwara Tea Garden Dr, San Francisco, CA 94118
about: The oldest public Japanese garden in the US with pagodas, koi ponds, and tea house.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Arrive right at opening (9am) for serene photos before crowds
Stop at the tea house for traditional tea and fortune cookies

name: Three Gems by James Turrell
address: 50 Hagiwara Tea Garden Dr, San Francisco, CA 94118
about: Hidden James Turrell skyspace installation outside the de Young Museum.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Sit, watch the sky, and listen to the world
No ticket or reservation required

name: Portals of the Past
address: Golden Gate Park, John F Kennedy Dr, San Francisco, CA 94117
about: Marble columns from a Nob Hill mansion destroyed in the 1906 earthquake.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Photograph the columns reflected in Lloyd Lake at sunrise
Walk around the lake to see the columns from different perspectives

name: Conservatory of Flowers
address:
100 John F Kennedy Dr
San Francisco, CA 94118
about: Victorian greenhouse and oldest building in Golden Gate Park with rare tropical plants.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Visit the Aquatic Plants room to see giant water lilies and carnivorous plants
Come during holiday season for spectacular light displays on the building

name: Bison Paddock
address: 1237 John F Kennedy Dr, San Francisco, CA 94121
about: Home to a herd of American bison since 1891 in Golden Gate Park.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Visit early morning (7-9am) when bison are most active and near the fence
Bring binoculars if they're grazing in the back of the paddock

name: Fort Mason Community Garden
address:
Pope Rd
San Francisco, CA, USA 94109
about: Terraced community garden at Fort Mason with stunning waterfront views.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Walk through the terraced gardens then continue to Fort Mason waterfront
Visit in spring/summer to see the gardens at their most lush

name: Bernal Heights Community Garden
address:
3501-3581 Folsom St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94110
about: Vibrant neighborhood garden with organic plots and fruit trees.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Check the bulletin board for free gardening workshops and events
Hike up Bernal Hill right after for 360-degree city views

name: Garden for the Environment
address:
1590 7th Ave
San Francisco, CA, USA 94122
about: Educational garden teaching sustainable practices with workshops and native plants.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Sign up for a free weekend workshop on composting or native plants
Explore the native plant section for California gardening ideas

name: Clipper Community Garden
address:
855 Clipper Terrace
San Francisco, CA, USA 94114
about: Hillside terraced garden with panoramic city views and colorful flowers.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Walk the terraced paths for unique city views between the garden plots
Visit in peak summer for the most colorful flower displays

name: Potrero Hill Community Garden
address:
780 San Bruno Ave
San Francisco, CA, USA 94107
about: One of San Francisco's oldest community gardens, established in the 1970s.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Explore the garden then check out local cafés and restaurants along 18th Street
Visit during monthly open houses to meet gardeners and learn tips

name: Alemany Farm
address:
700 Alemany Blvd
San Francisco, CA, USA 94110
about: San Francisco's largest urban farm spanning 3.5 acres with stunning views.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Join Saturday volunteer mornings (10am) to help with planting and harvesting
Take in the sweeping city views from this hilltop farm

name: Bubble Rock
address:
Bubble Rock Trail
Bar Harbor, ME, USA 04609
about: Massive 50-ton glacial boulder perched on South Bubble Mountain.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Take the classic 'pushing the rock' optical illusion photo
Continue to South Bubble summit for panoramic Jordan Pond views

name: Beehive Trail Summit
address:
Beehive Trail
Bar Harbor, ME, USA 04609
about: Thrilling hike featuring iron rungs and ladders on exposed cliff faces.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Arrive before 7am to avoid waiting at the iron rungs sections
Wear gloves for better grip on the metal rungs and ladders

name: Beal's Lobster Pier
address:
182 Clark Point Rd
Southwest Harbor, ME, USA 04679
about: Classic Maine seafood shack serving fresh lobster rolls with harbor views since 1985.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Order the warm buttered lobster roll over cold mayo version
Bring cash - they don't take cards but have an ATM nearby

name: McKay's Public House
address:
231 Main St
Bar Harbor, ME, USA 04609
about: Beloved seasonal Irish-style pub known for cozy atmosphere and craft beers.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Order fish & chips with a local Maine beer like Allagash or Shipyard
Peak season May-Oct; check ahead in winter to confirm hours

name: San Francisco International Airport
address:
San Francisco International Airport
San Francisco, CA, USA 94128
about: SFO was the first US airport with a museum (1980) and yoga room. The iconic Terminal 2 renovation with its locally-sourced materials won architectural awards for sustainability.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Explore the SFO Museum's rotating exhibits in all terminals - completely free
Try local favorites: Tony's Pizza Napoletana (Terminal 1) and Tartine (Terminal A)

name: Mill Valley Public Library
address:
375 Throckmorton Ave
Mill Valley, CA 94941
about: Award-winning 1966 library nestled among towering redwoods with floor-to-ceiling windows and a wood-burning fireplace.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Sit by the large windows overlooking the creek and redwood groves
Walk around behind the library into the woods and breathe in the fresh air

name: Castello di Amorosa
address:
4045 St Helena Hwy
Calistoga, CA, USA 94515
about: Authentic 13th century Tuscan castle winery built over 15 years with 107 rooms, moat, and drawbridge.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Book the Diamond Estate Tour for a guided walk through the Great Hall and wine caves
Book the Seated Tasting Experience to sample five wines while exploring the castle at your own pace

name: Hog Island Oyster Farm
address:
20215 Shoreline Hwy
Marshall, CA, USA 94940
about: Founded in the 1980s by marine biologists, this farm supplies fresh oysters to Bay Area restaurants including their Ferry Building oyster bar.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Dine outside and enjoy fresh oysters while looking out at Tomales Bay
Book a farm tour to learn about sustainable aquaculture and taste signature Sweetwater oysters

name: Bethesda Fountain
address:
Bethesda Fountain
New York, NY, USA 10024
about: Iconic Central Park fountain featuring Angel of the Waters by Emma Stebbins, the first woman to receive a public art commission in NYC in 1863.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Listen to street musicians who perform around the fountain
Walk through the arcade to see the restored Minton tile ceiling

name: Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis Reservoir
address:
Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis Reservoir
New York, NY 10128
about: Renamed in 1994 for Jackie Kennedy Onassis, who jogged here regularly. The 1.58-mile track offers stunning Manhattan skyline views.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Walk or run the 1.58-mile path around the reservoir for beautiful skyline views
Visit at sunrise or sunset for the most spectacular light on the water

name: The Ramble
address:
79th St Transverse
New York, NY 10024
about: 36-acre wilderness and one of North America's best birdwatching spots with over 230 species spotted here.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Bring binoculars during spring migration (April-May) for incredible birdwatching
Let yourself get lost on the winding paths - it's designed to feel like you've left the city

name: Conservatory Garden
address:
1233 5th Ave
New York, NY 10029
about: Central Park's only formal garden with 6 acres divided into Italian, French, and English styles.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Visit in spring (April-May) to see the famous Tulip Festival with 20,000+ tulips
Enter through the Vanderbilt Gate at 105th Street, one of Central Park's most ornate entrances

name: Bow Bridge
address:
Bow Bridge
New York, NY 10024
about: One of Central Park's most iconic bridges, built in 1862 with stunning Manhattan skyline views.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Visit at sunrise or golden hour for the best photos with soft light reflecting off the water
Walk to the center of the bridge for the classic view looking north toward the San Remo towers

name: The Mall and Literary Walk
address:
The Mall
New York, NY 10022
about: The only straight path in Central Park with a majestic canopy of American elm trees.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Visit Literary Walk at the southern end to see statues of famous writers like Shakespeare
Walk under the elm canopy in fall when the golden leaves create a natural tunnel

name: Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts
address:
Lincoln Center Plaza
New York, NY 10023
about: Home to the Metropolitan Opera, New York Philharmonic, and NYC Ballet.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Visit the David Rubenstein Atrium for free performances, coffee, and free WiFi in a beautiful public space
Come at night when the buildings are illuminated and the fountain is lit up for the most stunning photos

name: Domino Park
address:
15 River St
Brooklyn, NY 11249
about: Waterfront park built on the historic Domino Sugar Refinery site with Manhattan skyline views and preserved industrial artifacts.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Walk the elevated walkway for panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and Williamsburg Bridge
Explore the preserved industrial artifacts scattered throughout the park

name: Little Island
address:
Pier 55 at Hudson River Park, Hudson River Greenway
New York, NY 10014
about: Floating park built on 132 tulip-shaped pillars rising from the Hudson River, opened in 2021.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Walk the undulating pathways through over 350 species of trees, shrubs, and perennials
Bring a blanket and relax on the grassy hills while watching boats pass by on the Hudson

name: The Getty Museum
address:
1200 Getty Center Dr
Los Angeles, CA 90049
about: Art museum opened in 1997, home to Van Gogh's "Irises" and the stunning Central Garden designed by Robert Irwin.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Admission is always free (only parking costs $20, or $15 after 3pm)
Take in panoramic views of Los Angeles from various viewpoints around the hilltop campus

name: Griffith Observatory
address: 2800 E Observatory Rd, Los Angeles, CA 90027
about: This observatory is built on land donated by Griffith J. Griffith in 1896, who wanted it to be "a place where everyone could access the stars". It was later opened in 1935.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Stargaze through the public telescopes
Photograph the Hollywood Sign

name: Fern Canyon
address:
Fern Canyon
Orick, CA 95555
about: The unique landscape features 50-foot high walls covered in lush ferns and mosses. It served as a filming location for 1997 film The Lost World: Jurassic Park.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Be prepared to get wet and hike a moderate 1-mile loop through the heart of the canyon
Observe wildlife including Roosevelt elk and various bird species that inhabit the canyon and surrounding area

name: Kahekili Beach Park
address:
65 Kai Ala Dr
Lahaina, HI 96761
about: This beach is named after the last ruling chief of Maui, King Kahekili Nui ʻAhumanu. It is also known as "Airport Beach" after the Ka'anapali Airport that operated nearby from 1961 to 1986.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Snorkel with green sea turtles among the vibrant coral reefs (stay 10 feet away)
Parking at the free lot off Kai Ala Drive before 10AM

name: Mauna Kea
address: Mauna Kea Access Rd, Hilo, HI 96720
about: Hawaii's highest peak at 13,796 feet. The Keck Observatory here helped discover the supermassive black hole at our galaxy's center, earning a 2020 Nobel Prize.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Drive to the summit for sunset with a 4WD vehicle (required for the steep unpaved road) and witness one of the most spectacular sunset in the world.
Join the free nightly stargazing programs at the Visitor Information Station with telescopes and expert staff

name: General Sherman Tree
address: Three Rivers, CA 93262
about: The General Sherman Tree is the world's largest living tree by volume at 52,508 cubic feet. It is estimated to be between 2,300 and 2,700 years old.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Walk the paved half-mile Congress Trail loop to see the General Sherman Tree and other giant sequoias
Hike the Big Trees Trail, an easy 1.2-mile loop through the Giant Forest grove

name: Heavenly Mountain Resort
address: South Lake Tahoe, CA
about: You can ski across two states at Heavenly—California and Nevada—making it one of the few resorts where you can literally cross state lines on skis and snowboards.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Take the Heavenly Gondola to the summit for panoramic Lake Tahoe views
Enjoy terrain for all skill levels from beginner runs like First Ride to challenging expert runs like Gunbarrel

name: Moro Rock
address: Sequoia National Park, CA 93262
about: The dome formed over 100 million years ago during the Cretaceous period. The 400-step stairway was built by the Civilian Conservation Corps in 1931 and is carved directly into the granite.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Hike the quarter-mile trail to the summit
Watch the sunset with the unique granite formations from the top

name: Tunnel Log
address: Crescent Meadow Rd, Sequoia National Park, CA 93262
about: This fallen giant sequoia crashed across Crescent Meadow Road in 1937. Rather than removing it, park workers carved an 8-foot tall tunnel through the 275-foot tree in 1938.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Drive through the iconic tunnel carved into this 2,000-year-old fallen sequoia and snap the classic photo
Hike to Moro Rock nearby for panoramic views of the Sierra Nevada and collect a stamp

name: Giant Forest Museum
address: 47050 Generals Hwy, Three Rivers, CA 93271
about: Originally built in 1928 as a market, it reopened in 2001 as a museum dedicated to the Giant Forest ecosystem.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Learn about John Muir and early conservation efforts
Walk the Big Trees Trail loop (starts right outside)

name: Crescent Meadow
address: Cres Mdw Lp, California 93262
about: John Muir called this meadow "the gem of the Sierra" for its outstanding natural beauty. It features a 1.5-mile loop trail that's relatively easy and family-friendly.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Hike the 1.5-mile Crescent Meadow Loop Trail through giant sequoias
Enjoy a peaceful picnic surrounded by ancient trees (pack out what you pack in)
